soc.communication

Interface SOCMessageDispatcher

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MessageHandler, Sample3PClient, SOCDisplaylessPlayerClient, SOCRobotClient, SOCServerMessageDispatcher

    public interface SOCMessageDispatcher
    Dispatcher for all incoming messages from clients.
    This interface was created in v2.0.00 refactoring from the Server.processCommand(..) method.
    Since:
    2.0.00
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dispatch(SOCMessage message, Connection connection)
      Remove a queued incoming message from a client, and handle it.
      void dispatchFirst(SOCMessage message, Connection connection) 

    • Method Detail

      • dispatch

        void dispatch(SOCMessage message,
              Connection connection)
       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Remove a queued incoming message from a client, and handle it. Called from the message handler thread of Connection.

        Do not block or sleep in any derived code because this is single-threaded. Any slow or lengthy work for a message should be done on other threads.

        dispatch(..) must catch any exception thrown by conditions or bugs in server or gameName code it calls.

        The first message from a peer is dispatched by dispatchFirst(SOCMessage, Connection).

        Security Note: When there is a choice, always use local information over information from the message. For example, use the nickname from the connection to get the player information rather than the player information from the message. This makes it harder to send false messages making players do things they didn't want to do.

        Parameters:
        message - Message from the client. Will never be null.
        connection - Connection (peer) sending this message. Will never be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not ready to dispatch because some initialization method needs to be called first;

      • dispatchFirst

        void dispatchFirst(SOCMessage message,
                   Connection connection)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
